intro: Grosourdya quinquelobata, commonly known as the five-lobed grosourdia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Grosourdya quinquelobata prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
